meta.title: LAB SEVEN for Street Festivals | Labrador Field Systems
meta.description: Silent, scalable battery power for street festivals. No noise complaints, no fuel trucks, no permit battles.

hero.title: Power your festival without the generator headache
hero.tagline: Silent, scalable battery power for stages, vendors, and attractions. No noise complaints, no fuel trucks, no permit battles.

items.title: Scale power across the festival
items.description: One unit per stage, vendor row, or attraction zone. No massive generator infrastructure, no cable runs across public streets.

items.title: Zero noise impact on neighbors
items.description: Restaurants, shops, and residents don't hear your power source. Better community relations, easier annual permit renewals.

items.title: Simplified logistics and safety
items.description: No fuel deliveries during the event, no hot generators in public spaces, no fire watch requirements. Safer for crowds and volunteers.

problem.title: What festival organizers deal with today
problem.intro: Generator noise and logistics damage community relationships

items.title: Noise complaints
items.description: Generators create complaints from surrounding businesses and residents, threatening future permits.

items.title: Fuel logistics nightmare
items.description: Delivery and storage during events creates safety and access issues for vendors and attendees.

items.title: Health code conflicts
items.description: Generator exhaust conflicts with food vendor requirements and crowd comfort.

items.title: Multiplying costs
items.description: Multi-block festivals require generator every block. Costs multiply quickly.

items.title: Preserve goodwill
items.description: Silent operation preserves neighborhood goodwill and simplifies future permitting. First year without complaints means easier approvals next year.

items.title: Distributed power
items.description: Multiple units distributed across festival footprint‚Äîno central generator plant. Each zone gets dedicated power without noise or exhaust.

items.title: No refueling chaos
items.description: Zero refueling means no fuel trucks navigating festival crowds. Safer for attendees, volunteers, and vendors.

items.title: 10kW per zone
items.description: Each unit handles stage PA plus lighting, or 8-12 vendor booths. Scale up or down based on your festival footprint.

without.title: Without LAB SEVEN
without.description: Friday night: Generator trucks arrive, block street access for setup. Saturday morning: First fuel delivery interrupts vendor setup. Midday: Noise complaints from restaurants about lunch patio experience. Evening: Second refueling requires closing vendor row. Sunday: Generator removal delays street reopening for Monday commute.

with.title: With LAB SEVEN
with.description: Friday afternoon: LAB SEVEN units placed at each power zone before street closure. Fully charged, ready to go. All weekend: Silent operation, zero complaints. Vendors and stages powered seamlessly. Sunday evening: Festival wraps, units power down. Monday morning: Labrador Field Systems picks up batteries, street reopens on schedule.

caseStudy.title: Real festival, real results
content: Previous years: 2 large generators, average 8 noise complaints per year, $1,200 in generator rentals plus fuel.
With LAB SEVEN: 4 units distributed across festival. Zero noise complaints. Local restaurants reported better patio sales.
caseStudy.quote: First year in a decade without angry neighbors at the city council meeting.

items.question: How many units for a typical street festival?
items.answer: One unit per stage or power zone. We help you calculate based on your festival footprint, vendor count, and stage requirements.

items.question: Can we charge them overnight between festival days?
items.answer: Yes. Standard outlet overnight charging, or swap for charged units. Labrador Field Systems can handle charging service.

items.question: What if it rains?
items.answer: Fully weather-rated for outdoor use. Rain, heat, cold‚ÄîLAB SEVEN keeps running.

items.question: Can we use them for food trucks and concessions?
items.answer: Yes. Clean power safe for all food vendor equipment. Zero exhaust meets health code requirements.

items.question: What about backup power if something fails?
items.answer: Labrador Field Systems includes generator backup for critical loads, placed away from attendee areas.

finalCta.title: Ready to power your next festival?
finalCta.description: Contact Labrador Field Systems or book a demo
